thread.title: Arsenal news: Mesut Ozil given an extended break by Arsene Wenger due to secret injury | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Mesut Ozil given an extended break by Arsene Wenger due to secret injury | Metro News

author: Chris Davie For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Mesut Ozil given an extended break by Arsene Wenger due to secret injury | Metro News
text:
Chris Davie for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 7:53 am Mesut Ozil has been granted an extended rest by Arsene Wenger. (Getty Images) 
Arsene Wenger has given Mesut Ozil an extended break as the Arsenal midfielder is attempting to recover from back spasms, according to reports. 
The Times claim that the 28-year-old has been playing with pain in his back in recent weeks, which is why he was left out of the victory over Sutton United in the FA Cup on Monday evening. 
The Gunners, who sit fourth in the Premier League and 10 points behind leaders Chelsea, do not play again until March 4 when they travel to Liverpool. Ozil has been suffering from back spasms. (Getty Images) 
Wenger has granted Ozil a period of rest and the midfielder will now spent time in Germany and Turkey before returning to full training at the end of this week. 
Ozil was heavily criticised for his display in Arsenalâ€™s 5-1 defeat to Bayern Munich in the Champions League last week, although his agent, Dr Erkut Sogut, insists the backlash was excessive.
